example.eg: At last, they appeared at the far end of the beach.
example.egtrans: 他们终于远远出现在沙滩的尽头。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 出现, 显现, 显现

example.eg: It appears you were correct after all.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 似乎, 貌似, 显得

example.eg: Ken appears to be very dedicated to his family.
example.egtrans: 肯似乎对家庭很有奉献精神。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看起来像, 似乎, 表面上看

example.eg: Jenny appears to know what she's doing.
example.egtrans: 珍妮似乎知道她在做什么。

example.eg: The rain appears to be easing off.
I appear to have lost my umbrella.
example.egtrans: 看起来我是把伞搞丢了。

example.eg: The moon appeared huge through her telescope.  Audrey appears relaxed.
example.egtrans: 从她的望远镜里看去，月亮显得很大。奥德丽看起来很放松。

example.eg: He has appeared in several television shows.
example.egtrans: 他曾在几个电视节目中露面。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 在…里扮演角色，在…里参与演出，在…上公开露面

example.eg: The picture appeared in many newspapers.
example.egtrans: 这幅照片发表在很多份报纸上。

example.eg: The Black Death first appeared in England in 1348.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 出现, 发生, 产生

example.eg: The United Nations appeared as a result of the desire for global stability.
example.egtrans: 对国际稳定的渴望导致了联合国的产生。

example.eg: She will appear in court tomorrow to answer the charges.
Your Honor, I'm James Alfred III, appearing for the defendant.
example.egtrans: 法官大人，我是詹姆斯·阿尔弗雷德三世，我代替被告出庭。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 代理…出庭, 代替…出庭

example.eg: It appears as though your father is having a mid-life crisis.
My sister wrote a novel ten years ago, but I don't think it will ever actually appear in print.

dsense.name: summon [sb] to appear, summons [sb] to appear
dsense.guideword: often passive (call to appear in court)

example.eg: Karen has been summoned to appear before the High Court.
example.egtrans: 凯伦已被高等法庭传讯出庭。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 传讯…出（庭）, 传唤…出（庭）

example.eg: The doctor received a summons to appear and give his evidence.
